decks.notes: The deck aims to utilize the Underworld Breach combo, allowing for powerful and repetitive spells to be cast from the graveyard. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur artifacts and fuel the combo, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student can provide card advantage and dig for combo pieces. Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Mox Amber aid in ramping and fixing mana. The deck also includes control elements such as Unholy Heat and Spell Snare to disrupt opponents. Urza's Saga and Grinding Station provide additional combo pieces and win conditions.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells with cascade to cheat out powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Ardent Plea, the deck can quickly flood the board with threats like Scion of Draco and Crashing Footfalls. Leyline of the Guildpact and Subtlety help protect your creatures while cards like Force of Negation provide disruption against opposing spells. The mana base is designed to support the deck's ability to cast a variety of spells with different color requirements.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, enabling powerful combos with cards like Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card advantage and fueling the graveyard. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly while controlling the board with removal spells like Unholy Heat and Malevolent Rumble. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts. The deck aims to win through a quick and explosive combo finish, overwhelming the opponent before they can react.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Death's Shadow creature to its full potential by lowering your own life total to pump it up, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch. Murktide Regent provides an additional threat, while Psychic Frog helps filter through your deck. Thoughtseize and Surgical Extraction disrupt your opponent's game plan, while Spell Snare and Stubborn Denial protect your threats. The deck aims to quickly deplete your opponent's life total while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The core strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing a mix of hand disruption, counter spells, removal, and graveyard hate. By removing threats, countering key spells, and controlling the board, the deck aims to establish dominance and ultimately win the game through attrition. The inclusion of alternative win conditions and card advantage engines allows the deck to adapt to various scenarios and outmaneuver opponents. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana for spells.

The deck focuses on using Deceiver Exarch and Splinter Twin to create infinite creature tokens for a quick win. It also includes disruptive spells like Counterspell and Force of Negation to protect the combo. Additionally, it features efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Murktide Regent to apply pressure on the opponent. The main goal is to set up the combo as quickly as possible while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with unique abilities to control the board and generate value. By using cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Agatha's Soul Cauldron, the deck can efficiently remove threats and draw cards. The toolbox aspect is highlighted by the inclusion of Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith, allowing the player to search for specific creatures in response to the opponent's game plan. The deck also incorporates a combo potential with Grist, the Hunger Tide and Young Wolf, creating an endless loop of tokens for overwhelming board presence.
